pageContext.claim: “Saudi Arabia is a very wealthy country, and they've agreed to help defray some of [U.S. military] costs, which nobody else would ever ask for, of course.”
pageContext.analysis: Details are scant on the deal between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia. Previous administrations have had such agreements with the kingdom, but Trump tends to overstate what he has achieved. In Oct. 2019, Defense Secretary Mark T. Esper said it was a “burden sharing” deal, which does not necessarily mean money changes hands as Trump suggests.
